intro: Chaenostoma lyperioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf water-crowfoot, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Pontederiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, floating leaves that are typically divided into three to five lobes. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its root system helps stabilize sediments, contributing to water clarity and habitat for aquatic life.
